page.title: 08Farming
page.content: { West Wantly Poutry Farm} Since 1930 there has been a poutry farm at West Wantley which covers 4 five acre fields and contains over 9000 birds kept in huts 6' by 9'. These hold about 100 chicks each.They are fed with a mash which is taken round by tractor and trailer and put into troughs.When the eggs hatch,the chicks are seperated from their mothers and put in a different pen and a record is kept of their birth dates. Some chickens are kept for laying and they usually live for about 3 years. 800 to 1000 eggs are sold each week,to shops,at the gate or delivered personally.Laying Chickens are kept seperate from the table chicken which must be 16 weeks old before they get killed.3\ thousand chickens are sold each year on the table and some are sold alive.
